title: bug in spec/unit/filters/resource_spec.rb
body:
when running single spec 
```
 bundle exec rspec spec/unit/filters/resource_spec.rb 
```

it fails 

```

 1) ActiveAdmin::Filters::ResourceExtension should return the defaults if no filters are set
     Failure/Error:
       expect(resource.filters.keys).to match_array([
         :author, :body, :category, :created_at, :custom_created_at_searcher, :custom_title_searcher, :custom_searcher_numeric, :position, :published_date, :starred, :taggings, :title, :updated_at
       ])
     
       expected collection contained:  [:author, :body, :category, :created_at, :custom_created_at_searcher, :custom_searcher_numeric, :custom_title_searcher, :position, :published_date, :starred, :taggings, :title, :updated_at]
       actual collection contained:    [:author, :body, :category, :created_at, :position, :published_date, :starred, :taggings, :title, :updated_at]
       the missing elements were:      [:custom_created_at_searcher, :custom_searcher_numeric, :custom_title_searcher]
     # ./spec/unit/filters/resource_spec.rb:15:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'

  2) ActiveAdmin::Filters::ResourceExtension should return the defaults without associations if default association filters are disabled on the namespace
     Failure/Error:
       expect(resource.filters.keys).to match_array([
         :body, :created_at, :custom_created_at_searcher, :custom_title_searcher, :custom_searcher_numeric, :position, :published_date, :starred, :title, :updated_at
       ])
     
       expected collection contained:  [:body, :created_at, :custom_created_at_searcher, :custom_searcher_numeric, :custom_title_searcher, :position, :published_date, :starred, :title, :updated_at]
       actual collection contained:    [:body, :created_at, :position, :published_date, :starred, :title, :updated_at]
       the missing elements were:      [:custom_created_at_searcher, :custom_searcher_numeric, :custom_title_searcher]
     # ./spec/unit/filters/resource_spec.rb:37:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'

  3) ActiveAdmin::Filters::ResourceExtension adding a filter should preserve default filters
     Failure/Error:
             expect(resource.filters.keys).to match_array([
               :author, :body, :category, :count, :created_at, :custom_created_at_searcher, :custom_title_searcher, :custom_searcher_numeric, :position, :published_date, :starred, :taggings, :title, :updated_at
       
             ])
     
       expected collection contained:  [:author, :body, :category, :count, :created_at, :custom_created_at_searcher, :custom_searcher_numeric, :custom_title_searcher, :position, :published_date, :starred, :taggings, :title, :updated_at]
       actual collection contained:    [:author, :body, :category, :count, :created_at, :position, :published_date, :starred, :taggings, :title, :updated_at]
       the missing elements were:      [:custom_created_at_searcher, :custom_searcher_numeric, :custom_title_searcher]
     # ./spec/unit/filters/resource_spec.rb:106:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'

Finished in 0.09534 seconds (files took 3.32 seconds to load)
20 examples, 3 failures


```

is not reproduced when all tests are running , because needed ransacks are described in another spec. (spec/unit/filters/filter_form_builder_spec.rb)

to fix this we need to describe ransacks in rails template
